meanings.sent1: The wetproof jacket kept me dry in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She wore wetproof boots to walk through the puddles.
meanings.sent3: The wetproof umbrella laughed at the raindrops trying to soak through.
meanings.sent4: His wetproof skin seemed impervious to the downpour.
meanings.sent5: The wetproof seal on the container ensured no leaks would occur.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to water or moisture.
meanings.sent1: He wetproofed the tent before the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: She wetproofs her shoes with a special spray.
meanings.sent3: The chef wetproofed the recipe to ensure it wouldn't get ruined.
meanings.sent4: They wetproofed the basement to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent5: The gardener wetproofed the plants against heavy rain.
